issue.title: [CF 346] executing lua code for conditioning
issue.body:
I´m trying to build a tell me when based dps priority button that shows the ability a specific class such as priest should use basing on simulationcraft/elitistjerks. I´ve tried to include lua code into a condition icon but "If...then" does not work (tmw actually tells me it won´t work in the tooltip). Can anybody describe in short form how I would do something like

vampiric_touch,if=(!ticking|dot.vampiric_touch.remains<cast_time+2.5)&miss_react

in lua? I get the duration and actual cast time from this:

_, _, _, _, _, duration, expirationTime, _, _, _, _ = UnitAura("target","Schattenwort: Schmerz","player")
_, _, _, _, _, _, castTime, _, _ = GetSpellInfo(34914)

It would help if somebody could explain how to inlcude this via the tell me when conditions.


> Posted by CurseForge user mawo | Imported from CurseForge issue #346 | Raw

comments.body:
I don't know what miss_react is, so I will just ignore that part.

This should do what you want:

``` (select(UnitAura("target","Schattenwort: Schmerz","player"), 7) or 0) - time < (select(GetSpellInfo(34914), 7) + 2.5) ```

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
